content: The Snow Maiden is a Russian opera composed by Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov. It is based on the play of the same name by Alexander Ostrovsky, which tells the story of a young girl named Snegurochka (or "The Snow Maiden") who is the daughter of Spring and Frost. She falls in love with a mortal man named Lel, but ultimately must return to the spirit world, causing heartbreak for both her and Lel. The opera is known for its lush orchestration and its incorporation of traditional Russian folk melodies. It premiered in 1882 and is considered one of Rimsky-Korsakov's most popular works.
